intro: Paepalanthus cryocephalus, commonly known as the Antarctic buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the extreme environments of Antarctica. It is a member of the family Ranunculaceae and is adapted to survive in cold, harsh conditions with minimal nutrients. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom during the brief Antarctic summer. It has a compact growth form with hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. Due to its unique adaptations, it is considered one of the most resilient flowering plants in the world.
